CONJUGATES: instances (n., pl.) | instancing (v., pr. p.) | instanced (v., p. t.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French instance (urgency, pressing request), from Latin instantia (presence, persistence), derived from instāre (to stand near, be urgent), from in- ('in, on') + stāre ('to stand').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A particular occurrence or example of something.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: This is a perfect instance of why clear communication is essential.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这是一个说明清晰沟通为何至关重要的完美实例。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to introduce an example; for example.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We need better data entry controls; for instance, we could use dropdown menus.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们需要更好的数据录入控制；例如，我们可以使用下拉菜单。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In object-oriented programming, a concrete object created based on a class (blueprint).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （计算机科学、面向对象编程中）一个基于类创建的具体对象或实现。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: When the program starts, it initializes a single instance of the connection manager class.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 程序启动时，它会初始化连接管理器类的单个实例。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To cite or mention as an example.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The professor instanced several historical texts during his lecture.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 教授在讲座中举例说明了几篇历史文献。

REGISTER: Common in all registers; technical in computing contexts.
